radiographic_examinations.findings: The bases of the lungs are clear bilaterally. Mild dependent atelectasis is noted. No pericardial effusion. The liver enhances homogeneously with no focal lesion identified. No intrahepatic biliary dilatation. The gallbladder is without radiopaque cholelithiasis. The pancreas is unremarkable. The spleen is normal in size without focal abnormality identified, with a small splenule noted at the splenic hilum. The kidneys present symmetric nephrograms and excretion of contrast with no hydronephrosis or perinephric fluid collection. The appendix is dilated measuring 1.1 cm in diameter with hyperemic mucosa and thickened wall. The colon is unremarkable. The abdominal aorta is normal in caliber. No retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy. The bladder is moderately well distended and unremarkable. The uterus and bilateral adnexa are normal in appearance. There is no pelvic free fluid or abdominal adenopathy. No suspicious lytic or blastic lesions are identified.
